an3.129:4.1: Then Venerable Anuruddha went up to the Buddha,
an3.129:4.2: bowed, sat down to one side,
an3.129:4.4: “Sometimes, sir, with my clairvoyance that’s purified and superhuman, I see that females—when their body breaks up, after death—are mostly reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
an3.129:4.5: How many qualities do females have so that they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell?”
an3.129:5.1: “When they have three qualities females—when their body breaks up, after death—are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
an3.129:5.3: A female lives at home with a heart full of the stain of stinginess in the morning, envy at midday, and sexual desire in the evening.
an3.129:5.4: When they have these three qualities females—when their body breaks up, after death—are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.”
